[Portrait]Knight
[Dialog]A purse of five hundred gil
per head.{END}

[Portrait]Sellsword
[Dialog]'Tis coin I lack, not wits. Two thousand,
or you can stick them yourself.{END}

Mayhap you forget the ease with which
men are branded heretics.{END}

Threats, is it?
A thousand, then.{END}

Seven hundred. I can offer no more.{END}

Done. Let it never be said that I was
aught but a pious man.{END}

I pray your newfound piety lends not itself to
mercy. They will be here soon, and I shudder to
think of your fate should any of them survive.{END}

Hmph. No sooner speak the devil's
name, than he doth appear.

You've work to do. Best be about it.{END}

Gods be good, that's Ser Gaffgarion!
Seven hundred a head for this!?{END}

[Portrait]Gaffgarion
[Dialog]An ambush! This day grows lovelier
by the hour.{END}

[Portrait]Agrias
[Dialog]If you'd not fight, the road home lies
behind you.{END}

While I make no habit of charity,
I could not well abandon so goodly
a wench to rogues.{END}

Do not patronize me, -ser-!{END}

[Portrait]Agrias
[Dialog]We cannot linger. We must
find Lady Ovelia!{END}

[Portrait]Gaffgarion
[Dialog]And how shall we do that? Call out her

Her captors have but one place
